page.title: 14RELIGION
page.content: The main and most central church in the area is Odd Rode Parish Church.It is 121 years old.Built of millstone grit it is geographically central but separated from any residential area.It is opposite Rode Hall and financial assistance came from the Baker Wilbraham family.The Rector, Reverand Elbourne has responsibility for all members of the Parish whatever their denomination.He also has resposibility for two subsidiary chuches one of which is The Church of The Good Shepherd in Rode Heath.This was built in 1907.There is also a Methodist chapel in Rode Heath built in 1869. BOth these churches have Sunday Schools which are well attended. There is also a methodist chapel in Scholar Green.Over the past twenty years however there has been a notable decline in the number of church go'ers
